subject: Biology
question_text: The world produces over 100 million tonnes of nitrogen-containing fertiliser annually. Farmers spread this artificial fertiliser over their soil.
subtopic: Nitrogen Cycle, Agriculture, Human Impact on Ecosystems

difficulty.justification: Requires understanding of the nitrogen cycle in the context of agriculture and evaluation of the environmental impacts of fertiliser use.

sub_questions.text: Describe how nitrogen from the fertiliser can pass from the soil to eventually become part of the food which humans eat.
Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of the use of artificial nitrogen-containing fertilisers.
